DataElement.preferredName: Complete Resected Abdominal Cavity Disease Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the participant has intra-abdominal disease only and total resection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Complete Resected Abdominal Cavity Disease Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of completely resected (having been removed by surgery) abdominal cavity (the area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs) disease.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Complete Resected Abdominal Cavity Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Resected; having been removed by surgery.:(AB-do-men) The area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
